entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned in the text as a person who is present in the room. He is referred to by Dumbledore as 'Harry' and also as 'Tom Riddle', which is Voldemort's real name.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned in the text as a person who is present in the room. He is referred to by Harry as 'Dumbledore' and also as 'Tom Riddle', which is Voldemort's real name.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned in the text as a person who is present in the room. He is referred to by Dumbledore and Harry as 'Tom Riddle', which is his real name.

relationships.description: Dumbledore refuses to use Voldemort's chosen name, which is a refusal to allow Voldemort to dictate the terms of the meeting.
Dumbledore and Harry Potter have a mentor-student relationship, as Dumbledore is an old teacher who never quite forgets his charges' youthful beginnings.
Voldemort takes Dumbledore and Harry Potter as hostages, as he is dictating the terms of the meeting.
